title: @Ironstylus (or other artist) Is Leona crying in the PROJECT splash?
body: While I was looking at the splash for PROJECT: Leona skin, I noticed a single, lighter and grayer, line streaming down from where Leonas eye should be. Was this just coincidence or is she crying? I know skins dont always have lore to them, but what happened here if she is crying? Did she fail to protect someone? Is this new programming forcing her to take life? Does she miss being full human? @Ironstylus @otherartists

replies.body:
I don't know for certain if she's crying or not, but I wouldn't be surprised if that were the case.  PROJECT isn't (despite Leona's presence) all sunshine and smiles.  It'd be nice to hear more about that world.

I think they're still on for releasing them on [9/8](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/3qXbIdqV), right?  Not too long now.

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3060083&page=3#post45591877

To be fair, this was WAY before the big retcon.  That, and before Kitae was moved to live design.

If there ARE stories behind skins groups (Arcade, Battlecast, Mecha, PROJECT), I'd love to read them.  However, if we have to wait until the main universe is "in better shape," I just hope it's not going to take 31 years (at the rate of four per special event like Bilgewater) to get that done.  :)

Some is fine (and very welcomed by _this_ player); lots would seem like an odd allocation of resources,  Even when it might involve people from different teams or departments.  

Did that make any kind of sense?  I'm finding it tricky to convey this sort of nuance.

To paraphrase Solid Snake from MGS1:  _"Unfortunately, Rito-speek is just one of those things that gets easier the more you do it."_   

When Rioters get better at "communicating the Riot way," they stop being normal fans of League.  They may care about the game just as much, but they start to resemble the pod people from "Invasion of the Body Snatchers" to the rest of us.

I think the lore teams gets too much grief over the shape of the main universe; but with the new events like Bilgewater (and IMO just the general amount of *character* that goes into Champions now) that ship is finally being turned around in terms of community opinion.

I wholeheartedly agree with Bioluminescence. PROJECT was always meant to be a fun jaunt into fantasy without a clearly defined lore. That was by design because first and foremost PROJECT is about the Champions, not the world, and secondly any time and effort that could be spent on world-building for PROJECT was time that could be better spent on the core. I still hope PROJECT inspires you to theorycraft and fill in the blanks for yourself. I'm super excited to see what you think up.

I'm disappointed that there isn't a PROJECT: Riven with white armor and black hair.

Or a Senator Sion skin.

> PROJECT: Riven with white armor and black hair.

You trying to reference Raiden with Riven??? 

Yasuo already fills that role, and thematically even so (He negates the first damage by his shield, just as how Raiden negates damage through his pain inhibitors.)

Jetstream Sam, actually.

Which is weird, since Yasuo looks a lot more like Jetstream Sam...

Also halfway through the game Raiden stops using his pain inhibitors.

True, the whole Iado style of Sam can clearly be attributed to Yasuo's Q. 

But even then, Riven couldn't work as that type of reference. She's more of a Mistral/Sundowner type. Slash and crush you.

I was going more for the rivalry aspect. There is strong evidence pointing to them standing on the opposite side.

And Riven doesn't really work as Mistral, Mistral is athletic, likes to fight from relative distance, and relies on her control of Dwarf Geckos, and she also doesn't really work as Sundowner because Sundowner is a bruttish powerhouse with slow, but very powerful strikes. Elise and Darius/Sion work much better for those.
I don't think it has to be clearly defined. I'm not sure anyone expects ALL of the champions to be involved in each skin line like Project.
